page.title: 06Typical farm
page.content:
A local farmer descibed his farm as follows: The farm comprises of 6 buildings which are used for storing grain, hay, and housing cattle in winter. The older buildings are clay lump, the more recent ones brick or concrete. The main crops grown are wheat, barley, sugar beet, oats, hay and peas. The farm practises a system of rotation in order to maintain soil fertility. Some natural and some artificial fertilisers are used. Some crops are used as fodder for cattle and sheep, the rest is sent directly to customers by the farm lorry. The animals are sent to market in Norwich and Bury St. Edmunds. The farm covers 590 acres and employs 5 local people.
SC21CS
